definitions.definition: Ancient times; faraway history; former ages.
examples: Cicero was an eloquent orator of antiquity .

definitions.definition: The historical period preceding the Middle Ages (c. 500-1500), primarily relating to European history.
A relic or monument of ancient times, such as a coin, a statue, etc.; an ancient institution.
labels: often constructed as an uncountable plural
definitions.label_groups: often constructed as an uncountable plural

definitions.definition: The state of being ancient or of ancient lineage.

main_definition: Ancient times; faraway history; former ages.
secondary_definitions: ( history ) The historical period preceding the Middle Ages (c. 500-1500), primarily relating to European history.
( often constructed as an uncountable plural ) A relic or monument of ancient times, such as a coin, a statue, etc.; an ancient institution.
The state of being ancient or of ancient lineage.
